name: ContextAttributes
comment:
The properties of a WebGL rendering context.

If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.alpha is true, then the context has an alpha channel.

If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.antialias is true, then antialiasing is performed by the browser, but only if the browser's implementation of WebGL supports antialiasing.

If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.depth is true, then the context has a depth buffer of at least 16 bits.

If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.premultipliedAlpha is true, then the context's colors are assumed to be premultiplied. This means that color values are assumed to have been multiplied by their alpha values. If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.alpha is false, then this flag is ignored.

If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.preserveDrawingBuffer is false, then all contents of the context are cleared. If true, then all values will remain until changed or cleared.

If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.stencil is true, then the context has a stencil buffer of at least 8 bits.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-dom-web_gl.ContextAttributes.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
